result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Pope was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
$450.00 cash bond to be applied towards Court costs and the remainder to be returned to whomever posted it.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must personally deliver a written apology letter to the law enforcement officers involved.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed withinin the first 6 months of Probation.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin J Pope in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 4.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Count 3 is Dismissed and Read In.  State relates.  Attorney Hoel relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 1 year Probation
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Must personally deliver a written apology letter to the law enforcement officers involved
50 hours Community Service to be completed within the first 6 months
Court costs

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court - To report to jail Thursday, November 12, 2015, between 1:00 PM and 5:00 PM

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
